skill.name: add-core-function
skill.description: Add new core business logic functions to Catalyst-Relay. Use when creating pure functions, ADT operations, or library-consumable code.
skill.summary: Add new core business logic functions to Catalyst-Relay. Use when creating pure functions, ADT opera...
skill.author: Artisan-Edge

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only TypeScript code examples and project conventions. All 54 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting documentation patterns as security issues. The skill provides no executable code, scripts, network access, or filesystem operations.

content.value_statement: Need to extend Catalyst-Relay with new business logic for SAP ADT integration. This skill provides the patterns and checklist for adding pure functions, ADT operations, and library-consumable code that follows project conventions.
actual_capabilities: Create new ADT operations following CRAUD pattern
Implement pure business logic functions with proper exports
Add library-consumable functions to core modules
Apply import hierarchy rules to avoid circular dependencies
Follow Go-style async error tuple return types
Update barrel exports in index.ts files
limitations: Only provides guidance for Catalyst-Relay project
Does not execute code or create files directly
Does not validate SAP ADT server connectivity
Assumes developer has TypeScript and Bun environment set up

use_cases.title: Add ADT Operations
use_cases.description: Create new Create, Read, Activate, Update, Delete operations for SAP ADT objects

use_cases.title: Extend Library API
use_cases.description: Add new public functions to Catalyst-Relay library for downstream consumers

use_cases.title: Add Discovery Features
use_cases.description: Implement package browsing, tree traversal, or search functionality for ADT discovery

prompt_templates.title: New ADT Operation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use add-core-function to create a new ADT operation for [specific task, e.g., locking objects]. Follow the one-function-per-file pattern and use AsyncResult return type.

prompt_templates.title: Pure Function
prompt_templates.prompt: Use add-core-function to add a pure business logic function [describe function] to the appropriate domain in src/core/. Place internal helpers in helpers.ts.

prompt_templates.title: Discovery Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use add-core-function to create a new discovery function for [specific feature, e.g., getting transport list]. Include proper type definitions and barrel exports.

prompt_templates.title: Update Barrel Exports
prompt_templates.prompt: Use add-core-function to update the barrel exports in src/core/adt/index.ts to include the newly created [function name] function.

output_examples.input: Add a new function to check object lock status
output: Implements checkLock function with AsyncResult return type
Adds internal helper isObjectLocked in helpers.ts

output_examples.input: Add a function to list all packages in the system
output: Implements getPackages function with proper AdtRequestor type
Uses Go-style [data, null] or [null, error] returns

output_examples.input: Create a new discovery function for transport lists
output: Follows import hierarchy from types to helpers

best_practices: Keep each function in its own file following one-function-per-file pattern
Use Go-style [data, null] or [null, error] tuples for return types
Place internal helpers in helpers.ts, not in function files
Update barrel exports only for public API functions
anti_patterns: Putting multiple functions in a single file
Skipping the AsyncResult return type convention
Adding internal helpers as exported functions
Creating circular dependencies between module files

faq.question: What is Catalyst-Relay?
faq.answer: Catalyst-Relay is a TypeScript port of SNAP-Relay-API. It provides middleware bridging frontend applications to SAP ADT servers.

faq.question: Where should new functions be placed?
faq.answer: Create new function files in src/core/{domain}/{subfolder}/ directory. Follow the one-function-per-file pattern.

faq.question: What return type should async functions use?
faq.answer: Use Go-style AsyncResult<T> return type: [data, null] on success, [null, error] on failure. Import from '../../../types/result'.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides documentation only. It does not execute code, access files, or make network calls beyond reading skill files.

faq.question: How do I add exports to the public API?
faq.answer: Update the barrel exports in index.ts files. Use named exports like: export { functionName } from './subfolder/function'.

faq.question: Does this skill work with other AI coding assistants?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill follows patterns compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The TypeScript patterns are universal.
